pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.3.1: According to Sp 2.604 this means the bean curries should make up one quarter of the rice: Samasūpako nāma yattha bhattassa catutthabhāgappamāṇo sūpo hoti, “Wherever the bean curry is one quarter of the rice is called samasūpaka.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.5: The punctuation of MS has been corrected here so as to agree with Bu Sk 34:1.6. The text mistakenly had hatthahāriyo in the next sentence.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:1.13: According to the Kaṅkhāvitaraṇī commentary this means any curries apart from bean curry: Ṭhapetvā pana sūpaṁ avasesā sabbā pi sūpeyyabyañjanavikati rasaraso nāma hoti, “But apart from bean curry, all kinds of curry are called rasarasa.” My translation, however, is based on the fact that all other foods too are excluded.
